com.stormpath.spring.config

Class StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurerAdapter<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>
      • com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurer<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>

    @Configuration
public class StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer
extends org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurerAdapter<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>
    Since:
    1.0.RC5

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void doConfigure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.authentication.builders.AuthenticationManagerBuilder auth)
      Deprecated. 
      Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 
      
 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
      The old way:

      Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by doConfigure(AuthenticationManagerBuilder) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific ones.
      protected void doConfigure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http)
      Deprecated. 
      Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 
      
 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
      The old way:

      Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by doConfigure(HttpSecurity) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific security settings like: 

       http
   .authorizeRequests()
   .antMatchers("/account").fullyAuthenticated()
   .antMatchers("/admin").hasRole("ADMIN");
      protected void doConfigure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.WebSecurity web)
      Deprecated. 
      Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 
      
 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
      The old way:

      Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by doConfigure(WebSecurity) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific ones.
      void init(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http)
      The pre-defined Stormpath access control settings are defined here.
      static StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer stormpath()
      Extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method.

    • Method Detail

      • stormpath

        public static StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer stormpath()
        Extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 
         import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;
        Returns:
        the StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer object

      • init

        public void init(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http)
          throws Exception
        The pre-defined Stormpath access control settings are defined here.
        Specified by:
        init in interface org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurer<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>
        Overrides:
        init in class org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurerAdapter<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>
        Parameters:
        http - the HttpSecurity to be modified
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • doConfigure

        @Deprecated
protected void doConfigure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http)
                                throws Exception
        Deprecated. Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 
        
 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
        The old way:

        Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by doConfigure(HttpSecurity) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific security settings like: 

         http
   .authorizeRequests()
   .antMatchers("/account").fullyAuthenticated()
   .antMatchers("/admin").hasRole("ADMIN");
        Parameters:
        http - the HttpSecurity to modify
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • doConfigure

        @Deprecated
protected void doConfigure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.authentication.builders.AuthenticationManagerBuilder auth)
                                throws Exception
        Deprecated. Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 
        
 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
        The old way:

        Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by doConfigure(AuthenticationManagerBuilder) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific ones.

        Parameters:
        auth - the AuthenticationManagerBuilder to modify
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

        @Deprecated
protected void doConfigure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.WebSecurity web)
                                throws Exception
        Deprecated. Instead, extend WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter and configure the HttpSecurity object using the stormpath() utility method. For example: 
        
 import static com.stormpath.spring.config.StormpathWebSecurityConfigurer.stormpath;

 @Configuration
 public class SecurityConfig extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter {

     @Override
     public void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
        http.apply(stormpath())
        //other http config here
     }
 }
        The old way:

        Convenience Hook Method that will be invoked by doConfigure(WebSecurity) after configuring all the properties required by Stormpath. You can override this method to define app-specific ones.

        Parameters:
